[TITLE]
<line: 23> THE DEFENDANT:

[TEXT]

[TEXT]
<line: 26> pleaded nolo contendere to count(s)
<line: 27> which was accepted by the court.
<line: 28> was found guilty on count(s)
<line: 29>  after a plea of not guilty

[TEXT]
<line: 31> The defendant is adjudicated guilty of these offenses:

[TITLE]
<line: 33> Title & Section.

[TEXT]
<line: 35> Nature of Offense.

[TEXT]
<line: 37> 18 U.S.C.  922(g)(1) and 18 U.S.C.
<line: 38> Felon in Possession of a Firearm.
<line: 39> s 924(a)(2)

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 12/9/15

[TEXT]
<line: 43> The defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through  6 of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant
<line: 44> to the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984.

[TEXT]
<line: 46> The defendant has been found not guilty on count(s)

[TEXT]
<line: 48> dismissed on the motion of the United States.

[TEXT]
<line: 50> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the United States attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name, residence, or.
<line: 51> mailing address until all fines, restitution, costs, and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. If ordered to pay.
<line: 52> restitution, the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic circumstances.

[TITLE]
<line: 54> August 16, 2016

[TEXT]
<line: 56> Date of Imposition of Judgment

[TEXT]

<line: 59> Honorable Henry E. Autrey.
<line: 60> United States District Judge
<line: 61> Name & Title of Judge

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 4:16-cr-00007-HEA Doc. #: 44 Filed: 08/16/16 Page: 2 of 7 PagelD #: 157
<line: 3> AO 245B (Rev. 10/15)
<line: 4> Judgment in Criminal Case
<line: 5> Sheet 2 - Imprisonment.

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Judgment-Page
<line: 8> 2
<line: 9> of _6

[TITLE]
<line: 11> IMPRISONMENT

[TEXT]
<line: 13> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Federal Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 70 months

[TEXT]
<line: 15> This sentence shall run consecutive to any sentence imposed in the defendant's parole revocations under Docket No.: 911-03523, as these charges are not
<line: 16> related to the instant offense..

[TEXT]
<line: 18> While in the custody of the Bureau of Prisons, it is recommended the defendant be evaluated for participation in the Residential Drug Abuse Program and
<line: 19> mental health treatment. It is also recommended the defendant be evaluated for participation in an Occupational/Educational program, specifically, in
<line: 20> business administration. Such recommendations are made to the extent they are consistent with the Bureau of Prisons policies..

[TEXT]
<line: 22> That the defendant be placed in a medical facility..

[TEXT]

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district:.

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 29> a.m./pm on
<line: 30> as notified by the United States Marshal..

[TEXT]
<line: 32> The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons:.

[TEXT]
<line: 34> before 2 p.m. on
<line: 35> as notified by the United States Marshal.
<line: 36> as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office

[ABANDON]
<line: 38> MARSHALS RETURN MADE ON SEPARATE PAGE

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 4:16-cr-00007-HEA Doc. #: 44 Filed: 08/16/16 Page: 3 of 7 PagelD #: 158
<line: 3> AO 245B (Rev. 10/15)
<line: 4> Judgment in Criminal Case
<line: 5> Sheet 3 - Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> Judgment-Page 
<line: 8> of _6

[TITLE]
<line: 10> SUPERVISED RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 12> Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of Two years.

[TEXT]
<line: 14> The defendant must report to the probation office in the district to which the defendant is released within 72 hours of release from
<line: 15> the custody of the Bureau of Prisons.

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The defendant shall not commit another federal, state, or local crime..

[TEXT]
<line: 19> The defendant shall not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. The defendant shall refrain from any unlawful use of a
<line: 20> controlled substance. The defendant shall submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from imprisonment and at least two
<line: 21> periodic drug tests thereafter, as determined by the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 23> The above drug testing condition is suspended, based on the court's determination that the defendant poses a low risk
<line: 24> of future substance abuse. (Check, if applicable.)
<line: 25> X
<line: 26> The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon. (Check, if applicable.)
<line: 27> The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. (Check, if applicable.)
<line: 28> The defendant shall comply with the requirements of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C.  16901, et
<line: 29> seq.) as directed by the probation officer, the Bureau of Prisons, or any state sex offender registration agency in which he or she
<line: 30> resides, works, is a student, or was convicted of a qualifying offense. (Check, if applicable.)
<line: 31> The defendant shall participate in an approved program for domestic violence. (Check, if applicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 33> If this judgment imposes a fine or a restitution obligation, it shall be a condition of supervised release that the defendant pay in
<line: 34> accordance with the Schedule of Payments sheet of this judgment

[TEXT]
<line: 36> The defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court as well as with any additional
<line: 37> conditions on the attached page.

[TITLE]
<line: 39> STANDARD CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 1) the defendant shall not leave the judicial district without the permission of the court or probation officer;.

[TEXT]
<line: 43> 2) the defendant shall report to the probation officer in a manner and frequency directed by the court or probation officer;
<line: 44> 3) the defendant shall answer truthfully all inquiries by the probation officer and follow the instructions of the probation officer;
<line: 45> 4) the defendant shall support his or her dependents and meet other family responsibilities;
<line: 46> 5) the defendant shall work regularly at a lawful occupation, unless excused by the probation officer for schooling, training, or other
<line: 47> acceptable reasons;
<line: 48> 6) the defendant shall notify the probation officer at least ten days prior to any change in residence or employment;
<line: 49> 7) the defendant shall refrain from excessive use of alcohol and shall not purchase, possess, use, distribute, or administer any controlled
<line: 50> substance or any paraphernalia related to any controlled substances, except as prescribed by a physician;
<line: 51> 8) the defendant shall not frequent places where controlled substances are illegally sold, used, distributed, or administered;
<line: 52> 9) the defendant shall not associate with any persons engaged in criminal activity, and shall not associate with any person convicted
<line: 53> of a felony unless granted permission to do so by the probation officer;
<line: 54> 10) the defendant shall permit a probation officer to visit him or her at any time at home or elsewhere and shall permit
<line: 55> confiscation of any contraband observed in plain view of the probation officer;.
<line: 56> 11) the defendant shall notify the probation officer within seventy-two hours of being arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer;
<line: 57> 12) the defendant shall not enter into any agreement to act as an informer or a special agent of a law enforcement agency
<line: 58> without the permission of the court;
<line: 59> 13) as directed by the probation officer, the defendant shall notify third parties of risks that may be occasioned by the
<line: 60> defendant's criminal record or personal history or characteristics, and shall permit the probation officer to make such
<line: 61> notifications and to confirm the defendant's compliance with such notification requirement.

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 4:16-cr-00007-HEA Doc. #: 44 Filed: 08/16/16 Page: 4 of 7 PagelD #: 159
<line: 3> AO 245B (Rev. 10/15)
<line: 4> Judgment in Criminal Case
<line: 5> Sheet 3C - Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> 4
<line: 8> 6
<line: 9> Judgment-Page

[ABANDON]
<line: 11> DEFENDANT:
<line: 12>  MARLOW TATE ROBINSON
<line: 13> CASE NUMBER: _4:16CR7 HEA
<line: 14> District:
<line: 15> Eastern District of Missouri

[TITLE]
<line: 17> SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 19> While on supervision, the defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this Court and shall comply with
<line: 20> the following additional conditions. If it is determined there are costs associated with any services provided, the defendant shall pay those
<line: 21> costs based on a co-payment fee established by the probation office..

[TEXT]
<line: 23> The defendant shall refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled substance and submit to a drug test within 15 days of commencement of
<line: 24> supervision and at least two periodic drug tests thereafter for use of a controlled substance.

[TEXT]
<line: 26> The defendant shall participate in a substance abuse treatment program approved by the probation office, which may include substance
<line: 27> abuse testing, counseling, Residential Re-entry Center placement, residential or inpatient treatment.

[TEXT]
<line: 29> The defendant shall participate in a mental health evaluation and shall follow any recommendations of such and/or shall participate in a
<line: 30> mental health program approved by the probation office..

[TEXT]
<line: 32> The defendant shall participate in educational services program(s) as directed by the probation office. Such program(s) may include High
<line: 33> School Equivalency preparation, Adult Basic Education, Literacy, and other classes designed to improve the defendant's educational
<line: 34> proficiency.

[TEXT]
<line: 36> The defendant shall submit his person, residence, office, or vehicle to a search conducted by the probation office based upon reasonable
<line: 37> suspicion of contraband or evidence of a violation of a condition of release. The defendant shall warn any other residents that the premises
<line: 38> may be subject to searches pursuant to this condition..

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case: 4:16-cr-00007-HEA Doc. #: 44 Filed: 08/16/16 Page: 5 of 7 PagelD #: 160
<line: 3> AO 245B (Rev. 10/15)
<line: 4> Judgment in Criminal Case
<line: 5> Sheet 5 - Criminal Monetary Penalties

[TITLE]
<line: 7> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 9> The defendant must pay the total criminaI monetary penalties under the schedule of payments on sheet 6
<line: 10> A ssessment
<line: 11> Fine

[TEXT]
<line: 13> Totals:

[TEXT]
<line: 15> The determination of restitution is deferred until
<line: 16> An Amended Judgment in a Criminal Case (AO 245C)
<line: 17> will be entered after such a determination..

[TEXT]
<line: 19>  The defendant must make restitution (including community restitution) to the following payees in the amount listed below.

[TEXT]
<line: 21> If the defendant makes a partial payment, each payee shall receive an approximately proportional payment unless specified
<line: 22> otherwise in the priority order or percentage payment column below. However, pursuant ot 18 U.S.C. 3664(i), all nonfederal
<line: 23> victims must be paid before the United States is paid

[ABANDON]
<line: 25> Total Loss*
<line: 26> Restitution Ordered Priority or Percentage

[ABANDON]
<line: 28> Name of Payee

[TEXT]
<line: 30>  Restitution amount ordered pursuant to plea agreement

[TEXT]
<line: 32>  The defendant must pay interest on restitution and a fine of more than $2,500, unless the restitution or fine is paid in full
<line: 33> before the fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  3612(f). All.of the payment options on
<line: 34> Sheet 6 may be subject to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. s 3612(g).

[TEXT]
<line: 36> The court determined that the defendant does not have the ability to pay interest and it is ordered that:.

[TEXT]
<line: 38> The interest requirement is waived for the.

[TEXT]
<line: 40> The interest requirement for the  fine   restitution is modified as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 42> * Findings for the total amount of losses are required under Chapters 109A, 110, 110A, and 113A of Title 18 for offenses
<line: 43> committed on or after September 13, 1994 but before April 23, 1996..

[ABANDON]

<line: 6> 6

[TITLE]
<line: 8> DEFENDANT: MARLOW TATE ROBINSON
<line: 9> CASE NUMBER: 4:16CR7 HEA
<line: 10> District:
<line: 11> Eastern District of Missouri
<line: 12> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 14> Having assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payment of the total criminal monetary penalties shall be due as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 16> B  Payment to begin immediately (may be combined with
<line: 17>  C,  D, or  Ebelow; or Fbelow;or

[TEXT]
<line: 19> C  Payment in equal
<line: 20> (e.g., equal, weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of
<line: 21> over a period of
<line: 22> e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 23> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after the date of this judgment; or
<line: 24> D  Payment in equal
<line: 25> (e.g., equal, weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of
<line: 26> over a period of
<line: 27> e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 28> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from imprisonment to a
<line: 29> term of supervision; or

[TEXT]
<line: 31> E  Payment during the term of supervised release will commence within
<line: 32> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after Release from
<line: 33> imprisonment. The court will set the payment plan based on an assessment of the defendant's ability to pay at that time: or
<line: 34> F  Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties:

[TEXT]
<line: 36> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criminal monetary penalties is due
<line: 37> during the period of imprisonment. All criminal monetary penalty payments, except those payments made through the Bureau of Prisons
<line: 38> Inmate Financial Responsibility Program are made to the clerk of the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 40> The defendant will receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed.

[ABANDON]
<line: 42> Joint and Several

[TEXT]
<line: 44> Defendant and Co-defendant Names and Case Numbers (including defendant number), Total Amount, Joint and Several Amount,
<line: 45> and corresponding payee, if appropriate.

[TEXT]
<line: 47> The defendant shall pay the cost of prosecution.
<line: 48> The defendant shall pay the following court cost(s):

[TEXT]
<line: 50> The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States:

[TEXT]
<line: 52> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1 ) assessment; (2) restitution principal, (3) restitution interest, (4) fine principal,
<line: 53> (5)fine interest (6) community restitution.(7) penalties, and (8) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs.
